quoteFirst: [4] The bell of the church called the Badia, or Abbey, which stood within the old walls of Florence, rang daily the hours for worship, and measured the time for the Florentines. Tierce is the first division of the canonical hours of the day, from six to nine; nones, the third, from
title: The Divine Comedy, Volume 3, Paradise

quoteFirst: “Last night, for instance, I was in agony from
quoteLast: --in agony. I don’t know what I should have done without my vegetable electricity. I took it at three, and the pain vanished immediately.”

quoteFirst: Everything then is served in courses, and if you are late you simply have to go without the things that were served before you sat down. In the middle of the day we rest, for it is as hot as our hottest summer from
quoteLast: . After that we drive, or visit some church or museum, ending with afternoon tea. If you happen to have friends at some hotel, it is fun to drop in there.
title: Irma in Italy: A Travel Story
author: Reed, Helen Leah, 1860?-1926; McCullough, W. A. (William A.) [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: I found out the place where the P.E.'s were to be found and for the last seven days I have been every day to that place (which is from five to six miles from Salzburg) and there I have waited from
quoteLast: , through rain and everything else, hoping and hoping for a passing sunbeam, as I could see them every now and then at the tops of the trees, and if the sun had but come out for a few minutes some of them would have been sure to have come down and settled in the road.
title: Life of Frederick Courtenay Selous, D.S.O., Capt. 25th Royal Fusiliers
author: Millais, John Guille, 1865-1931

quoteFirst: But the village of Marquion was on the east of the canal, and on the Arras-Cambrai road, and at 11.45 a.m. the village was still holding out, which made it impossible for the 169th Brigade to keep to the time-table and be in position for attack by
quoteLast: It was therefore decided to postpone the attack until 3.28 p.m.
